item.title: 在这一天：2019 年，前总统吉米-卡特成为美国历史上最长寿的行政长官；他的寿命为 94 岁零 172 天，超过了已故前总统乔治-H-W-布什。
item.description:
ON THIS DAY: In 2019 former President Jimmy Carter became the longest-living chief executive in American history; at 94 years and 172 days, he exceeded the lifespan of the late former President George H.W. Bush. https://t.co/dhUvBvsVlF pic.twitter.com/1aGhCvqlyk

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 一些专家说，特朗普支持的慈善机构 "边境 911"（Border911）可能 "触犯法律"，它以边境为重点推动影响选举。
item.description:
Trump-backed charity Border911 may be "breaking the law" with border-focused push to influence election, some experts say. https://t.co/ohgv5UHPbr

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: "《公路豪情》问世 35 年来，已经形成了一种邪教声誉，它是一部烂到让人无法自拔的电影，让人忍不住去欣赏它，因为它在自己的糟糕中享受着无耻的快乐。这种罪恶的快感必须重启。"
item.description:
"In the 35 years since its debut, 'Road House' developed a cult reputation as a movie so bad that you couldn’t help but enjoy it for the shameless joy it took in its own awfulness. There had to be a reboot of this guilty pleasure." https://t.co/ri9Nqx62kf

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）周四宣布，现在可以让人们与家人和朋友共享常旅客积分，一些小型航空公司已经提供了这一功能。
item.description:
United Airlines announced Thursday it is now letting people pool and share their frequent-flyer points with family and friends, a feature already offered by some smaller carriers. https://t.co/JX46UVehXg

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 根据最新研究，全球气温上升可能对农业和全球通货膨胀造成的压力将可能导致食品价格进一步上涨。
item.description:
The strain that rising global temperatures could have on the agriculture industry and inflation around the world will likely cause food prices to increase even more, according to new research. https://t.co/BC8TjM6vXt

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 一项新的分析显示，目前在美国买房要比租房贵得多，预计至少在未来五年内，房地产市场都将如此。
item.description:
Buying a house in the U.S. is considerably more expensive than renting right now, and the real estate market is expected to stay that way for at least the next five years, according to a new analysis. https://t.co/5rjqN4lU4z

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 弗吉尼亚州谢南多郡的一场野火烧毁了至少五座房屋，官员们说，该地区发生了多起 "严重 "火灾。
item.description:
At least five homes were destroyed by a wildfire in Virginia’s Shenandoah County, officials said, as several “serious” fires burned in the area. pic.twitter.com/9UDrPlWLDo

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 内布拉斯加州的护士收养了她们在新生儿重症监护室照顾过的女婴："如果这是你的心愿，我会说去做吧，不要逃避，因为有[很多]孩子需要收养"。
item.description:
Nebraska nurses adopt baby girl they cared for in the NICU: "If it's something that's on your heart, I would say go for it and don't steer away, because there are [many] kids that need adoption." https://t.co/Mdt9y3T7lv

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 据白宫称，最新的学生债务免除将使白宫政府为近 400 万美国人免除的债务总额达到约 1,440 亿美元。
item.description:
The latest student debt cancellations will bring his administration's total forgiveness to about $144 billion for nearly 4 million Americans, according to the White House. https://t.co/jOLsd7NBLQ

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 一位母亲的四胞胎新生儿重症监护病房住院账单总额超过 400 万美元，引发了人们对美国医疗费用高昂的讨论。
item.description:
A mom's hospital bills for her quadruplets' neonatal intensive care unit stay, totaling over $4 million, is sparking a conversation about the high cost of health care in the United States. https://t.co/swXQCVKYLG pic.twitter.com/vUUDcc0ujS

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 2023 年星巴克假日礼品套装中销售的四种带金属涂层的陶瓷杯被召回，原因是有报告称容器过热或破裂，可能继续造成伤害。

item.title: 众议院能源和商业委员会已启动了一项针对美国器官移植系统的两党调查，这是继参议院和举报人指控美国器官移植系统失灵和管理不善的报告之后，对该系统进行的最新一次审查。
item.description:
The House Committee on Energy and Commerce has launched a bipartisan investigation into the U.S. organ transplant system — the latest scrutiny of the system following reports from the Senate and whistleblowers alleging its failures and mismanagement. https://t.co/KwqyFMgXAt

item.title: 为配合世界水日而发布的《2024 年联合国世界水资源开发报告》指出，清洁、安全的水资源是我们这个世界的 "重要纽带"，对促进和平至关重要：
item.description:
Access to clean and safe water is the "great connector" of our world and critical in promoting peace, according to the 2024 U.N. World Water Development Report released to coincide with World Water Day.

Learn more: https://t.co/qpo6JbYGaz pic.twitter.com/hSaP8NHYlI

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 田纳西州州长比尔-李（Bill Lee）周四签署了一项立法，旨在保护词曲作者、表演者和其他音乐行业专业人士免受人工智能的潜在危险，并向该州最具代表性的居民之一致敬。
item.description:
In a nod to one of the state's most iconic residents, Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee on Thursday signed off on legislation designed to protect songwriters, performers and other music industry professionals against the potential dangers of artificial intelligence. https://t.co/wU1WhARc90 pic.twitter.com/1JhTUDTkeK

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 阿拉巴马州州长凯-艾维（Kay Ivey）签署了一项大刀阔斧的法案，禁止将州政府资金用于州政府机构、高等教育机构和其他公共实体的 DEI 计划和办公室。
item.description:
Alabama Gov. Kay Ivey has signed a sweeping bill that prohibits the use of state funds for DEI programs and offices at state agencies, higher education institutions and other public entities. https://t.co/vGZSqti9Em

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 俄克拉荷马州塔尔萨县地方检察官周四表示，不会对俄克拉荷马州少年奈克斯-本尼迪克特（Nex Benedict）在死前一天卷入的斗殴事件提出指控：
item.description:
No charges will be filed in connection with a fight that Oklahoma teen Nex Benedict was involved in a day before they died, the Tulsa County district attorney said Thursday.

Learn more: https://t.co/J1KdQm5vW9 pic.twitter.com/r5gjhOINKY

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 新文件显示，特朗普在与拜登的竞争中面临重大经济劣势，因为法律账单蚕食了盟友的现金。

item.title: 据当局称，两名少年在被送往佐治亚州奥古斯塔的一家青少年拘留中心时从警方手中逃脱，据称他们在周四打晕了一名副警长，之后又被重新关押。
item.description:
Two juveniles who escaped from police while being transported to a youth detention center in Augusta, Georgia, are back in custody after allegedly knocking out a deputy on Thursday, authorities say. https://t.co/It4BmwxuuK

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 美国疾病预防控制中心的数据显示，在过去二十年里，美国因吸毒过量死亡的人数几乎每年都在上升，并不断刷新年度记录，成为美国历史上最严重的吸毒过量流行病。
item.description:
Over the last two decades, the number of U.S. overdose deaths has risen almost every year and continued to break annual records — making it the worst overdose epidemic in American history, CDC figures show. https://t.co/Sq2arz614q

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024

item.title: 根据教科文组织的报告，约有 22 亿人无法获得安全管理的饮用水，35 亿人无法获得安全管理的卫生设施。
item.description:
About 2.2 billion people live without access to safely managed drinking water and 3.5 billion people lack access to safely managed sanitation, according to UNESCO report. https://t.co/m64hlWAQKB

— ABC News (@ABC) March 22, 2024
